div.head: To the Most worthy and experienced Captaine, the Lieutenant and all the well Disciplined companie, Trained vp in the Militarie yard at Norwich.
div.p:
ACcept yee this smal piece, in lieu of the great loue, which I haue alway borne to your Laudable exercise; which (if I might haue my wish) should not onely out line Enuie, but many ages also, yea rather end with time then in it. As for the fortune of this Treatise; I rather
aspicate it from your gentle acceptance, then any worth of itselfe. Yet I would haue the world know, that it comes from him, that dares as well vindi • ate it from the finister constructions, of maleuolous Critickes, as gratefully acknowledge the gracious censure of the curteous Reader.
